TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit DynamicObject extends System.Object implements class System.Dynamic.IDynamicMetaObjectProvider

summary.span: 提供用于指定运行时的动态行为的基类。

span.span: Provides a base class for specifying dynamic behavior at run time.

summary.span: 必须继承此类；不能直接对其进行实例化。

span.span: This class must be inherited from; you cannot instantiate it directly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 利用 `DynamicObject` 类，您可以定义可对动态对象执行哪些操作，以及如何执行这些操作。The `DynamicObject` class enables you to define which operations can be performed on dynamic objects and how to perform those operations. 例如，你可以定义当你尝试获取或设置对象属性、调用方法或执行标准数学运算（如加法和乘法）时所发生的情况。For example, you can define what happens when you try to get or set an object property, call a method, or perform standard mathematical operations such as addition and multiplication. 如果要为库创建更方便的协议，此类会很有用。This class can be useful if you want to create a more convenient protocol for a library. 例如，如果你的库用户必须使用类似 `Scriptobj.SetProperty("Count", 1)`的语法，则可以提供更简单的语法，如 `scriptobj.Count = 1`。For example, if users of your library have to use syntax like `Scriptobj.SetProperty("Count", 1)`, you can provide the ability to use much simpler syntax, like `scriptobj.Count = 1`. 不能直接创建 `DynamicObject` 类的实例。You cannot directly create an instance of the `DynamicObject` class. 若要实现动态行为，你可能想要从 `DynamicObject` 类继承并重写必要的方法。To implement the dynamic behavior, you may want to inherit from the `DynamicObject` class and override necessary methods. 例如，如果只需要用于设置和获取属性的操作，则可以只覆盖 和 方法。For example, if you need only operations for setting and getting properties, you can override just the and methods. 在C#中，若要为从 `DynamicObject` 类派生的类的实例启用动态行为，必须使用 `dynamic` 关键字。In C#, to enable dynamic behavior for instances of classes derived from the `DynamicObject` class, you must use the `dynamic` keyword. 有关更多信息，请参见[使用类型 dynamic](~/docs/csharp/programming-guide/types/using-type-dynamic.md)。For more information, see [Using Type dynamic](~/docs/csharp/programming-guide/types/using-type-dynamic.md). 在 Visual Basic 中，后期绑定支持动态操作。In Visual Basic, dynamic operations are supported by late binding. 有关详细信息，请参阅[早期和后期绑定](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d6ff7f1e-b94f-4205-ab8d-5cfa91758724)。For more information, see [Early and Late Binding](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d6ff7f1e-b94f-4205-ab8d-5cfa91758724). 下面的代码示例演示如何创建派生自 `DynamicObject` 类的类的实例。The following code example demonstrates how to create an instance of a class that is derived from the `DynamicObject` class. ```csharp public class SampleDynamicObject : DynamicObject {} //... dynamic sampleObject = new SampleDynamicObject (); ``` ```vb Public Class SampleDynamicObject Inherits DynamicObject '... Dim sampleObject As Object = New SampleDynamicObject() ``` 你还可以将自己的成员添加到从 `DynamicObject` 类派生的类。You can also add your own members to classes derived from the `DynamicObject` class. 如果你的类定义了属性，并且还重写了 方法，则动态语言运行时（DLR）首先使用语言联编程序在类中查找属性的静态定义。If your class defines properties and also overrides the method, the dynamic language runtime (DLR) first uses the language binder to look for a static definition of a property in the class. 如果没有此类属性，则 DLR 会调用 方法。If there is no such property, the DLR calls the method. `DynamicObject` 类实现了 DLR 接口 ，使你能够在支持 DLR 互操作性模型的语言之间共享 `DynamicObject` 类的实例。The `DynamicObject` class implements the DLR interface , which enables you to share instances of the `DynamicObject` class between languages that support the DLR interoperability model. 例如，你可以在中C#创建 `DynamicObject` 类的实例，然后将其传递给 IronPython 函数。For example, you can create an instance of the `DynamicObject` class in C# and then pass it to an IronPython function. 有关详细信息，请参阅[动态语言运行时概述](~/docs/framework/reflection-and-codedom/dynamic-language-runtime-overview.md)。For more information, see [Dynamic Language Runtime Overview](~/docs/framework/reflection-and-codedom/dynamic-language-runtime-overview.md). > [!NOTE] > 如果你有一个简单的方案，在此方案中，你需要一个仅可在运行时添加和删除成员的对象，但这不需要定义特定操作，并且没有静态成员，请使用 类。If you have a simple scenario in which you need an object that can only add and remove members at run time but that does not need to define specific operations and does not have static members, use the class. > > 如果你有一个更高级的方案，在此方案中，需要定义动态对象如何参与互操作性协议，或者需要管理 DLR 快速动态调度缓存，请创建你自己的 接口实现。If you have a more advanced scenario in which you need to define how dynamic objects participate in the interoperability protocol, or you need to manage DLR fast dynamic dispatch caching, create your own implementation of the interface. ## Examples 假设你想要提供用于访问字典中的值的替代语法，以便可以编写 `sampleDictionary.Text = "Sample text"`，而不是编写 `sampleDictionary["Text"] = "Sample text"` （`sampleDictionary("Text") = "Sample text"` 在 Visual Basic 中）。Assume that you want to provide alternative syntax for accessing values in a dictionary, so that instead of writing `sampleDictionary["Text"] = "Sample text"` (`sampleDictionary("Text") = "Sample text"` in Visual Basic), you can write `sampleDictionary.Text = "Sample text"`. 此外，您希望此语法不区分大小写，以便 `sampleDictionary.Text` 等效于 `sampleDictionary.text`。Also, you want this syntax to be case-insensitive, so that `sampleDictionary.Text` is equivalent to `sampleDictionary.text`. 下面的代码示例演示 `DynamicDictionary` 类，该类派生自 `DynamicObject` 类。The following code example demonstrates the `DynamicDictionary` class, which is derived from the `DynamicObject` class. `DynamicDictionary` 类包含 `Dictionary` 类型的对象（Visual Basic 中的`Dictionary(Of String, Object)`）以存储键-值对，并重写 和 方法来支持新的语法。The `DynamicDictionary` class contains an object of the `Dictionary` type (`Dictionary(Of String, Object)` in Visual Basic) to store the key-value pairs, and overrides the and methods to support the new syntax. 它还提供了一个 `Count` 属性，该属性显示字典包含的动态属性的数目。It also provides a `Count` property, which shows how many dynamic properties the dictionary contains. [!code-csharp[System.Dynamic.DynamicObject#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.dynamic.dynamicobject/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Dynamic.DynamicObject#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.dynamic.dynamicobject/vb/module1.vb#1)] 有关更多示例，请参阅C#常见问题博客上的[创建包含 DynamicObject 的包装](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/csharpfaq/dynamic-in-c-4-0-creating-wrappers-with-dynamicobject/)。For more examples, see [Creating Wrappers with DynamicObject](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/csharpfaq/dynamic-in-c-4-0-creating-wrappers-with-dynamicobject/) on the C# Frequently Asked Questions blog.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 类派生的类可以重写此方法，以指定应如何对动态对象执行二元运算。Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify how binary operations should be performed for a dynamic object. 如果未重写此方法，则该语言的运行时联编程序将确定行为。When the method is not overridden, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. （大多数情况下，将引发语言特定的运行时异常。）(In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.) 当你有二元运算（例如加法或乘法）时，将调用此方法。This method is called when you have binary operations such as addition or multiplication. 例如，如果 方法被重写，则会自动为 `sum = first + second` 或 `multiply = first*second`之类的语句调用，其中 `first` 是从 `DynamicObject` 类派生的。For example, if the method is overridden, it is automatically invoked for statements like `sum = first + second` or `multiply = first*second`, where `first` is derived from the `DynamicObject` class. 可以通过使用 `binder` 参数的 `Operation` 属性来获取有关二元运算类型的信息。You can get information about the type of the binary operation by using the `Operation` property of the `binder` parameter. 如果动态对象仅用于C#和 Visual Basic，则 `binder.Operation` 属性可具有 枚举中的以下值之一。If your dynamic object is used only in C# and Visual Basic, the `binder.Operation` property can have one of the following values from the enumeration. 但是，在其他语言（如 IronPython 或 IronRuby）中，可以具有其他值。However, in other languages such as IronPython or IronRuby, you can have other values. |值Value|说明Description|C#C#|Visual BasicVisual Basic| |-----------|-----------------|---------|------------------| |`Add`|对于数值操作数，不进行溢出检查的加法运算。An addition operation without overflow checking, for numeric operands.|`a + b`|`a + b`| |`AddAssign`|加法复合赋值运算，不对数值操作数进行溢出检查。An addition compound assignment operation without overflow checking, for numeric operands.|`a += b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`And`|按位 `AND` 运算。A bitwise `AND` operation.|`a & b`|`a And b`| |`AndAssign`|按位 `AND` 复合赋值运算。A bitwise `AND` compound assignment operation.|`a &= b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`Divide`|算术除法运算。An arithmetic division operation.|`a / b`|`a / b`| |`DivideAssign`|算术除法复合赋值运算。An arithmetic division compound assignment operation.|`a /= b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`ExclusiveOr`|按位 `XOR` 运算。A bitwise `XOR` operation.|`a ^ b`|`a Xor b`| |`ExclusiveOrAssign`|按位 `XOR` 复合赋值运算。A bitwise `XOR` compound assignment operation.|`a ^= b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`GreaterThan`|"大于" 比较。A "greater than" comparison.|`a > b`|`a > b`| |`GreaterThanOrEqual`|"大于或等于" 比较。A "greater than or equal to" comparison.|`a >= b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`LeftShift`|按位左移运算。A bitwise left-shift operation.|`a << b`|`a << b`| |`LeftShiftAssign`|按位左移复合赋值运算。A bitwise left-shift compound assignment operation.|`a <<= b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`LessThan`|"小于" 比较。A "less than" comparison.|`a < b`|`a < b`| |`LessThanOrEqual`|"小于或等于" 比较。A "less than or equal to" comparison.|`a <= b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`Modulo`|算术余数运算。An arithmetic remainder operation.|`a % b`|`a Mod b`| |`ModuloAssign`|算术余数复合赋值运算。An arithmetic remainder compound assignment operation.|`a %= b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`Multiply`|对于数值操作数，不进行溢出检查的乘法运算。A multiplication operation without overflow checking, for numeric operands.|`a * b`|`a * b`| |`MultiplyAssign`|对于数值操作数，不进行溢出检查的乘法复合赋值运算。A multiplication compound assignment operation without overflow checking, for numeric operands.|`a *= b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`NotEqual`|不相等比较。An inequality comparison.|`a != b`|`a <> b`| |`Or`|按位或逻辑 `OR` 运算。A bitwise or logical `OR` operation.|`a | b`|`a Or b`| |`OrAssign`|按位 or 逻辑 `OR` 复合赋值。A bitwise or logical `OR` compound assignment.|`a |= b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`Power`|对数字进行幂运算的数学运算。A mathematical operation of raising a number to a power.|不支持。Not supported.|`a ^ b`| |`RightShift`|按位右移运算。A bitwise right-shift operation.|`a >> b`|`a >> b`| |`RightShiftAssign`|按位右移复合赋值运算。A bitwise right-shift compound assignment operation.|`a >>= b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`Subtract`|对于数值操作数，不进行溢出检查的减法运算。A subtraction operation without overflow checking, for numeric operands.|`a - b`|`a - b`| |`SubtractAssign`|对于数值操作数，不进行溢出检查的减法复合赋值运算。A subtraction compound assignment operation without overflow checking, for numeric operands.|`a -= b`|不支持。Not supported.| > [!NOTE] > 若要在中C#为动态对象实现 `OrElse` （`a || b`）和 `AndAlso` （`a && b`）操作，你可能希望同时实现 方法和 方法。To implement `OrElse` (`a || b`) and `AndAlso` (`a && b`) operations for dynamic objects in C#, you may want to implement both the method and the method. > > `OrElse` 操作包含一元 `IsTrue` 操作和二元 `Or` 运算。The `OrElse` operation consists of the unary `IsTrue` operation and the binary `Or` operation. 仅当 `IsTrue` 操作的结果 `false`时，才执行 `Or` 操作。The `Or` operation is performed only if the result of the `IsTrue` operation is `false`. > > `AndAlso` 操作包含一元 `IsFalse` 操作和二元 `And` 运算。The `AndAlso` operation consists of the unary `IsFalse` operation and the binary `And` operation. 仅当 `IsFalse` 操作的结果 `false`时，才执行 `And` 操作。The `And` operation is performed only if the result of the `IsFalse` operation is `false`. ## Examples 假设您需要一个数据结构来存储数字的文本和数值表示形式，并且您想要为此类数据定义基本的数学运算，如加法和减法。Assume that you need a data structure to store textual and numeric representations of numbers, and you want to define basic mathematical operations such as addition and subtraction for such data. 下面的代码示例演示 `DynamicNumber` 类，该类派生自 类。The following code example demonstrates the `DynamicNumber` class, which is derived from the class. `DynamicNumber` 重写 方法以启用数学运算。`DynamicNumber` overrides the method to enable mathematical operations. 它还将重写 和 方法，以便能够访问元素。It also overrides the and methods to enable access to the elements. 在此示例中，仅支持加法和减法操作。In this example, only addition and subtraction operations are supported. 如果尝试编写类似 `resultNumber = firstNumber*secondNumber`的语句，则会引发运行时异常。If you try to write a statement like `resultNumber = firstNumber*secondNumber`, a run-time exception is thrown. remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 类派生的类可以重写此方法，以指定应如何对动态对象执行类型转换。Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify how a type conversion should be performed for a dynamic object. 如果未重写此方法，则该语言的运行时联编程序将确定行为。When the method is not overridden, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. （大多数情况下，将引发语言特定的运行时异常。）(In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.) 在C#中，如果重写此方法，则会在你具有显式或隐式转换时自动调用，如下面的代码示例中所示。In C#, if this method is overridden, it is automatically invoked when you have an explicit or implicit conversion, as shown in the code example below. 在 Visual Basic 中，仅支持显式转换。In Visual Basic, only explicit conversion is supported. 如果重写此方法，则可以使用 或 函数调用它。If you override this method, you call it by using the or functions. ```csharp // Explicit conversion. String sampleExplicit = (String)sampleObject; // Implicit conversion. String sampleImplicit = sampleObject; ``` ```vb // Explicit conversion - first variant. Dim testExplicit1 = CTypeDynamic(Of String)(sampleObject) // Explicit conversion - second variant. Dim testExplicit2 = CTypeDynamic(sampleObject, GetType(String)) ``` ## Examples 假设您需要一个数据结构来存储数字的文本和数值表示形式，并且您希望将此数据结构的转换定义为字符串和整数。Assume that you need a data structure to store textual and numeric representations of numbers, and you want to define conversions of this data structure to strings and integers. 下面的代码示例演示 `DynamicNumber` 类，该类派生自 类。The following code example demonstrates the `DynamicNumber` class, which is derived from the class. `DynamicNumber` 重写 方法以启用类型转换。`DynamicNumber` overrides the method to enable type conversion. 它还将重写 和 方法，以启用对数据元素的访问。It also overrides the and methods to enable access to the data elements. 在此示例中，仅支持转换为字符串和整数。In this example, only conversion to strings and integers is supported. 如果尝试将对象转换为其他任何类型，则会引发运行时异常。If you try to convert an object to any other type, a run-time exception is thrown. [!code-csharp[System.Dynamic.DynamicObject#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.dynamic.dynamicobject/cs/program.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Dynamic.DynamicObject#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.dynamic.dynamicobject/vb/module1.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 类派生的类可以重写此方法，以指定应该如何为动态对象执行按索引获取值。Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify how getting a value by index should be performed for a dynamic object. 如果未重写此方法，则该语言的运行时联编程序将确定行为。When the method is not overridden, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. （大多数情况下，将引发运行时异常。）(In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.) 如果重写此方法，则会在 Visual Basic 中具有 `sampleObject[3]` C#或 `sampleObject(3)` （其中 `sampleObject` 派生自 类）时，自动调用此方法。If this method is overridden, it is automatically invoked when you have an operation like `sampleObject[3]` in C# or `sampleObject(3)` in Visual Basic, where `sampleObject` is derived from the class. ## Examples 假设要创建一个对象，在该对象中，可以通过名称（如 `Property0`、`Property1`等）或索引来访问属性，这样，`sampleObject.Property0` 等效于 `sampleObject(0)` 中的 `sampleObject[0]` C#或 Visual Basic 中的。Assume that you want to create an object in which properties can be accessed either by names such as `Property0`, `Property1`, and so on, or by index, so that, for example, `sampleObject.Property0` is equivalent to `sampleObject[0]` in C# or `sampleObject(0)` in Visual Basic. 下面的代码示例演示 `SampleDynamicObject` 类，该类派生自 类。The following code example demonstrates the `SampleDynamicObject` class, which is derived from the class. `SampleDynamicObject` 类包含 `Dictionary` 类型的对象（Visual Basic 中的`Dictionary(Of String, Object)`）以存储键值对。The `SampleDynamicObject` class contains an object of the `Dictionary` type (`Dictionary(Of String, Object)` in Visual Basic) to store the key-value pairs. `SampleDynamicObject` 重写 和 方法以按索引启用访问。`SampleDynamicObject` overrides the and methods to enable access by index. 它会重写 和 方法，以通过属性名称启用访问。It overrides the and methods to enable access by property name. remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 类派生的类可以重写此方法，以指定如何为动态对象执行获取成员值的操作。Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify how operations that get member values should be performed for a dynamic object. 如果未重写此方法，则该语言的运行时联编程序将确定行为。When the method is not overridden, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. （大多数情况下，将引发运行时异常。）(In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.) 当语句 `Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty)`（其中 `sampleObject` 是派生自 类的类的实例）时，将调用此方法。This method is called when you have statements like `Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty)`, where `sampleObject` is an instance of the class derived from the class. 你还可以将自己的成员添加到从 `DynamicObject` 类派生的类。You can also add your own members to classes derived from the `DynamicObject` class. 如果你的类定义了属性，并且还重写了 方法，则动态语言运行时（DLR）首先使用语言联编程序在类中查找属性的静态定义。If your class defines properties and also overrides the method, the dynamic language runtime (DLR) first uses the language binder to look for a static definition of a property in the class. 如果没有此类属性，则 DLR 会调用 方法。If there is no such property, the DLR calls the method. ## Examples 假设你想要提供用于访问字典中的值的替代语法，以便可以编写 `sampleDictionary.Text = "Sample text"`，而不是编写 `sampleDictionary["Text"] = "Sample text"` （`sampleDictionary("Text") = "Sample text"` 在 Visual Basic 中）。Assume that you want to provide alternative syntax for accessing values in a dictionary, so that instead of writing `sampleDictionary["Text"] = "Sample text"` (`sampleDictionary("Text") = "Sample text"` in Visual Basic), you can write `sampleDictionary.Text = "Sample text"`. 此外，此语法必须不区分大小写，以便 `sampleDictionary.Text` 等效于 `sampleDictionary.text`。Also, this syntax must be case-insensitive, so that `sampleDictionary.Text` is equivalent to `sampleDictionary.text`. 下面的代码示例演示 `DynamicDictionary` 类，该类派生自 类。The following code example demonstrates the `DynamicDictionary` class, which is derived from the class. `DynamicDictionary` 类包含 `Dictionary` 类型的对象（Visual Basic 中的`Dictionary(Of String, Object)`）以存储键-值对，并重写 和 方法来支持新的语法。The `DynamicDictionary` class contains an object of the `Dictionary` type (`Dictionary(Of String, Object)` in Visual Basic) to store the key-value pairs, and overrides the and methods to support the new syntax. 它还提供了一个 `Count` 属性，该属性显示字典包含的动态属性的数目。It also provides a `Count` property, which shows how many dynamic properties the dictionary contains. Visual Basic 编译器从不发出代码以使用此方法，并且 Visual Basic 语言不支持类似 `sampleObject(100)`的语法。The Visual Basic compiler never emits code to use this method, and the Visual Basic language does not support syntax like `sampleObject(100)`. ## Examples 假设您需要一个数据结构来存储数字的文本和数值表示形式。Assume that you need a data structure to store textual and numeric representations of numbers. 您希望能够分别为每个属性指定值，还可以在单个语句中初始化所有属性。You want to be able to specify the value for each property individually and also to be able to initialize all properties in a single statement. 下面的代码示例演示 `DynamicNumber` 类，该类派生自 类。The following code example demonstrates the `DynamicNumber` class, which is derived from the class. `DynamicNumber` 重写 方法，以便一次启用所有属性的初始化。`DynamicNumber` overrides the method to enable initialization of all properties at one time. 它还会重写 和 方法，以启用对单个对象属性的访问。It also overrides the and methods to enable access to individual object properties. remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 类派生的类可以重写此方法，以指定如何为动态对象执行调用对象成员的操作。Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify how operations that invoke an object member should be performed for a dynamic object. 如果未重写此方法，则该语言的运行时联编程序将确定行为。When the method is not overridden, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. （大多数情况下，将引发语言特定的运行时异常。）(In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.) 如果重写此方法，则在执行 `sampleObject.SampleMethod(100)`（其中 `sampleObject` 派生自 `DynamicObject` 类）时，将自动调用此方法。If this method is overridden, it is automatically invoked when you perform an operation like `sampleObject.SampleMethod(100)`, where `sampleObject` is derived from the `DynamicObject` class. 你还可以将自己的方法添加到派生自 类的类。You can also add your own methods to classes that are derived from the class. 例如，如果重写 方法，动态调度系统将首先尝试确定指定方法是否存在于类中。For example, if you override the method, the dynamic dispatch system first attempts to determine whether the specified method exists in the class. 如果找不到方法，它将使用 实现。If it does not find the method, it uses the implementation. 此方法不支持 `ref` 和 `out` 参数。This method does not support `ref` and `out` parameters. `args` 数组中的所有参数都按值传递。All parameters in the `args` array are passed by value. ## Examples 假设你想要提供用于访问字典中的值的替代语法，以便可以编写 `sampleDictionary.Text = "Sample text"`，而不是编写 `sampleDictionary["Text"] = "Sample text"` （`sampleDictionary("Text") = "Sample text"` 在 Visual Basic 中）。Assume that you want to provide alternative syntax for accessing values in a dictionary, so that instead of writing `sampleDictionary["Text"] = "Sample text"` (`sampleDictionary("Text") = "Sample text"` in Visual Basic), you can write `sampleDictionary.Text = "Sample text"`. 此外，你还希望能够对此字典调用所有标准字典方法。Also, you want to be able to call all the standard dictionary methods on this dictionary. 下面的代码示例演示 `DynamicDictionary` 类，该类派生自 类。The following code example demonstrates the `DynamicDictionary` class, which is derived from the class. `DynamicDictionary` 类包含 `Dictionary` 类型的对象（Visual Basic 中的`Dictionary(Of String, Object)`）以存储键值对。The `DynamicDictionary` class contains an object of the `Dictionary` type (`Dictionary(Of String, Object)` in Visual Basic) to store the key-value pairs. 它重写 方法，以支持 类的方法，并重写 和 方法来支持新的语法。It overrides the method to support methods of the class and overrides the and methods to support the new syntax. 它还提供了一个 `Print` 方法，该方法将输出所有字典键和值。It also provides a `Print` method, which prints out all dictionary keys and values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 类派生的类可以重写此方法，以指定应该如何为动态对象执行通过索引访问对象的操作。Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify how operations that access an object by index should be performed for a dynamic object. 如果未重写此方法，则该语言的运行时联编程序将确定行为。When the method is not overridden, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. （大多数情况下，将引发语言特定的运行时异常。）(In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.) 如果重写此方法，则会在 Visual Basic 中具有 `sampleObject[3] = 10` C#或 `sampleObject(3) = 10` （其中 `sampleObject` 派生自 类）时，自动调用此方法。If this method is overridden, it is automatically invoked when you have an operation like `sampleObject[3] = 10` in C# or `sampleObject(3) = 10` in Visual Basic, where `sampleObject` is derived from the class. ## Examples 假设要创建一个对象，在该对象中，可以通过名称（如 `Property0`、`Property1`等）或索引来访问属性，这样，`sampleObject.Property0` 等效于 `sampleObject(0)` 中的 `sampleObject[0]` C#或 Visual Basic 中的。Assume that you want to create an object in which properties can be accessed either by names such as `Property0`, `Property1`, and so on, or by index, so that, for example, `sampleObject.Property0` is equivalent to `sampleObject[0]` in C# or `sampleObject(0)` in Visual Basic. 下面的代码示例演示 `SampleDynamicObject` 类，该类派生自 类。The following code example demonstrates the `SampleDynamicObject` class, which is derived from the class. `SampleDynamicObject` 类包含 `Dictionary` 类型的对象（Visual Basic 中的`Dictionary(Of String, Object)`）以存储键值对。The `SampleDynamicObject` class contains an object of the `Dictionary` type (`Dictionary(Of String, Object)` in Visual Basic) to store the key-value pairs. `SampleDynamicObject` 重写 和 方法以按索引启用访问。`SampleDynamicObject` overrides the and methods to enable access by index. 它会重写 和 方法，以通过属性名称启用访问。It overrides the and methods to enable access by property name. remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 类派生的类可以重写此方法，以指定如何为动态对象执行将值设置为成员的操作。Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify how operations that set a value to a member should be performed for a dynamic object. 如果未重写此方法，则该语言的运行时联编程序将确定行为。When the method is not overridden, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. （大多数情况下，将引发语言特定的运行时异常。）(In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.) 当语句 `sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test"`（其中 `sampleObject` 是派生自 类的类的实例）时，将调用此方法。This method is called when you have statements like `sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test"`, where `sampleObject` is an instance of the class that is derived from the class. 你还可以将自己的成员添加到从 `DynamicObject` 类派生的类。You can also add your own members to classes derived from the `DynamicObject` class. 如果你的类定义了属性，并且还重写了 方法，则动态语言运行时（DLR）首先使用语言联编程序在类中查找属性的静态定义。If your class defines properties and also overrides the method, the dynamic language runtime (DLR) first uses the language binder to look for a static definition of a property in the class. 如果没有此类属性，则 DLR 会调用 方法。If there is no such property, the DLR calls the method. ## Examples 假设你想要提供用于访问字典中的值的替代语法，以便可以编写 `sampleDictionary.Text = "Sample text"`，而不是编写 `sampleDictionary["Text"] = "Sample text"` （`sampleDictionary("Text") = "Sample text"` 在 Visual Basic 中）。Assume that you want to provide alternative syntax for accessing values in a dictionary, so that instead of writing `sampleDictionary["Text"] = "Sample text"` (`sampleDictionary("Text") = "Sample text"` in Visual Basic), you can write `sampleDictionary.Text = "Sample text"`. 此外，此语法必须不区分大小写，以便 `sampleDictionary.Text` 等效于 `sampleDictionary.text`。Also, this syntax must be case-insensitive, so that `sampleDictionary.Text` is equivalent to `sampleDictionary.text`. 下面的代码示例演示 `DynamicDictionary` 类，该类派生自 类。The following code example demonstrates the `DynamicDictionary` class, which is derived from the class. `DynamicDictionary` 类包含 `Dictionary` 类型的对象（Visual Basic 中的`Dictionary(Of String, Object)`）以存储键-值对，并重写 和 方法来支持新的语法。The `DynamicDictionary` class contains an object of the `Dictionary` type (`Dictionary(Of String, Object)` in Visual Basic) to store the key-value pairs, and overrides the and methods to support the new syntax. 它还提供了一个 `Count` 属性，该属性显示字典包含的动态属性的数目。It also provides a `Count` property, which shows how many dynamic properties the dictionary contains. remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 类派生的类可以重写此方法，以指定应如何对动态对象执行一元运算。Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify how unary operations should be performed for a dynamic object. 如果未重写此方法，则该语言的运行时联编程序将确定行为。When the method is not overridden, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. （大多数情况下，将引发语言特定的运行时异常。）(In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.) 当你有一元运算，如求反、递增或递减时，将调用此方法。This method is called when you have unary operations such as negation, increment, or decrement. 例如，如果 方法被重写，则会为 `negativeNumber = -number`（其中 `number` 派生自 类）自动调用此方法。For example, if the method is overridden, this method is automatically invoked for statements like `negativeNumber = -number`, where `number` is derived from the class. 可以通过使用 `binder` 参数的 `Operation` 属性获取有关一元运算类型的信息。You can get information about the type of the unary operation by using the `Operation` property of the `binder` parameter. 如果动态对象仅用于C#和 Visual Basic，则 `binder.Operation` 属性可具有 枚举中的以下值之一。If your dynamic object is used only in C# and Visual Basic, the `binder.Operation` property can have one of the following values from the enumeration. 但是，在其他语言（如 IronPython 或 IronRuby）中，可以具有其他值。However, in other languages such as IronPython or IronRuby, you can have other values. |值Value|说明Description|C#C#|Visual BasicVisual Basic| |-----------|-----------------|---------|------------------| |`Decrement`|一元减量运算。A unary decrement operation.|`a--`|不支持。Not supported.| |`Increment`|一元增量运算。A unary increment operation.|`a++`|不支持。Not supported.| |`Negate`|算术反运算。An arithmetic negation.|`-a`|`-a`| |`Not`|逻辑求反。A logical negation.|`!a`|`Not a`| |`OnesComplement`|二进制反码。A ones complement.|`~a`|不支持。Not supported.| |`IsFalse`|错误条件值。A false condition value.|`a && b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`IsTrue`|True 条件值。A true condition value.|`a || b`|不支持。Not supported.| |`UnaryPlus`|一元加。A unary plus.|`+a`|`+a`| > [!NOTE] > 若要在中C#为动态对象实现 `OrElse` （`a || b`）和 `AndAlso` （`a && b`）操作，你可能希望同时实现 方法和 方法。To implement `OrElse` (`a || b`) and `AndAlso` (`a && b`) operations for dynamic objects in C#, you may want to implement both the method and the method. > > `OrElse` 操作包含一元 `IsTrue` 操作和二元 `Or` 运算。The `OrElse` operation consists of the unary `IsTrue` operation and the binary `Or` operation. 仅当 `IsTrue` 操作的结果 `false`时，才执行 `Or` 操作。The `Or` operation is performed only if the result of the `IsTrue` operation is `false`. > > `AndAlso` 操作包含一元 `IsFalse` 操作和二元 `And` 运算。The `AndAlso` operation consists of the unary `IsFalse` operation and the binary `And` operation. 仅当 `IsFalse` 操作的结果 `false`时，才执行 `And` 操作。The `And` operation is performed only if the result of the `IsFalse` operation is `false`. ## Examples 假设您需要一个数据结构来存储数字的文本和数值表示形式，并且您想要为此类数据定义数学求反运算。Assume that you need a data structure to store textual and numeric representations of numbers, and you want to define a mathematical negation operation for such data. 下面的代码示例演示 `DynamicNumber` 类，该类派生自 类。The following code example demonstrates the `DynamicNumber` class, which is derived from the class. `DynamicNumber` 重写 方法以启用数学求反运算。`DynamicNumber` overrides the method to enable the mathematical negation operation. 还将重写 和 方法，以启用对元素的访问。Is also overrides the and methods to enable access to the elements. 在此示例中，仅支持数学求反运算。In this example, only the mathematical negation operation is supported. 如果尝试编写类似 `negativeNumber = +number`的语句，则会发生运行时异常。If you try to write a statement like `negativeNumber = +number`, a run-time exception occurs.
